document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Lectotype female ( designated here in accordance with ICZN Art. 74) ( Figs. 13–15 ), labelled: “Type | sculpta Püng. ♀ ” (pink paper, handwritten with printed ‘Type’), “ LECTOTYPUS | Leucanitis |
sculpta Püngeler, 1904
| Dt. ent. Z. Iris 16 (2): 292; pl. 6, f. 8 | Korb, Matov, Volynkin des. |
2016, Feb. 1–4
” (red paper, printed); two-side filled label, first side “abgebildet v. John, | Hor. S. E. Ross 39, | t. 16 fig. 7 b”, second side “ sculpta Püng. | ♀ ” (white paper, handwritten); twoside filled label, first side “Asia centr. | Togus-torau | Rückbeil 1901”, second side “ sculpta Püng. ♀ | Original | v. R. Tancré 5.05” (white paper, handwritten with printed ‘Asia centr.’) ( ZMHU )
.
Paralectotypes : 2 females ( ZMHU )
.
Distribution. Mountains of Central Asia, deserts of Southern Kazakhstan .

Variability . There are two subspecies described: nominate (lowland-middle mountainous) and
pamira
(high mountainous). The status of the populations from the Kazakhstanian deserts requires clarification.

Nekrasov et al ., 1988: 51
[Arslanbob, Dugoba, Malinovoe valley]; Milko, 1996: 258 [Chuiskaya valley and Chong-Kemin river valley (with closely located slopes of Kirghizsky and Kungey-Ala-Too Mts.), Regions close to Fergana (including southern slopes of Chatkalsky and Fergansky Mts. and northern slopes of Alai and Turkestansky Mts.)];
Lehmann et al ., 1998: 527
[Ili area, Tschu river, Mujunkum, 200 m ; Ili river, Bakanas vill., 400 m ; Ili area, Charyn river, 400 m ]; Lehmann, Bergmann, 2005: 20 [Kirgizsky Mts., Central and western part (Naryn), Fergansky Mts., Alai Mts.]; Korb, 2013: 28 [ 33 km N of Panfilov, Boro-Khoro Mts., N 44 29.765 E 80 03.848 , 1 830 m ; 35 km N of Bakanas, Ili River Valley, N 44 53.940 E 75 53.479 , 377 m].
Habitat ( Figs. 304 , 306, 307, 309 ). Lowlands and mountain foothills, deserts and semideserts, steppes, but mostly on sands. Elevation: 200–1600 m .
Distribution . Deserts of South Kazakhstan , mountains of Tian-Shan and Alai Mts. (northern slope).

Material examined (in total: 53 specimens ).
